file_content.text: Shh, there are eyes on me. I must pretend I don't know you. Oh please, please don't hurt me!
The data you obtained was all wrong. My contacts refuse to pay us. Blast Lord Grathan--he must have moved the files!
You've returned. The sounds of battle echoing through the compound was like music. Made me want to dance.
Well, don't leave me in suspense. Did you download the cybernetics data? Are we going to be rich?
Very, very rich--I hope.
We are.
I got the data.
Finally! I've waited so long for this moment.
Depends--can you deliver what you promised?
That's up to you.
Oh, I'll deliver. You'll see.
Everything is in place. I'll send the data spike to my contacts so they can extract and verify the data.
It'll be raining credits before you know it. I'm so grateful you crossed my path. You've made my dreams come true.
Enjoy your dreams while they last.
For now, anyway.
Oh, I intend to.
You're welcome.
Fulfillment of any fantasies was unintentional, believe me.
I didn't mean to.
I'll take it however I can get it.
We'll be paid as soon as my contacts authenticate the data. It shouldn't take long.
Once my contacts authenticate the data, you'll see a sizeable deposit of credits. Let's hope we got everything off that console.
The entire compound is on high alert. Don't waste a moment downloading that data.
Yes! Violent intruders, laying waste to Lord Grathan's compound. I applaud you all.
Yes! A violent intruder, laying waste to Lord Grathan's compound. I applaud you.
I'm Ismar Brengle, one of Lord Grathan's "indentured" scientists. I'd like to make your destruction of this place highly profitable.
You're happy I'm destroying Lord Grathan's compound?
You like what I'm doing?
Beyond happy--I'm practically giddy.
Interesting.
Good. We're natural allies, believe it or not.
Why should I trust you?
I doubt that.
Because I despise Lord Grathan with the fiery heat of a thousand Tatooine deserts.
Three years ago, Lord Grathan lured me to work for him. He promised great opportunities in exciting fields of study.
Instead I became a prisoner, slaving on freakish creations Grathan uses to advance himself. It's a thankless existence.
You must act on your hatred and kill Grathan.
Destroy your oppressor.
Kill him? Don't be absurd. He's untouchable to someone like me. I'll have to settle for stealing from him.
Sith dominate lesser beings. That is our prerogative.
Life isn't fair, worm.
Perhaps, but Grathan does it so bluntly, so... artlessly. Don't you expect better from your fellow Sith?
Scholars are often pawns of the powerful.
Such is life.
I intend to change that--with your help.
That's the risk you take whenever you work for someone else.
Deal with it.
The forfeiture of all human rights? That seems a bit much, don't you think?
Freakish creations?
Please, don't ask me to describe the horrors Grathan demanded I develop for him. The work sickens me.
You're boring me.
Yes, yes. I'm just getting to that part.
Grathan's cybernetics researchers--a sadistic bunch of scum--developed cyborg body parts that regenerate. The technology will revolutionize warfare. It's worth a fortune.
I have a buyer looking to manufacture a cyborg army. You'll get sixty percent of my profits if you steal the cybernetic researchers' files.
For terms that generous, I think we can do business together.
You have a deal.
Excellent--you won't be disappointed.
I expect a big payoff.
You won't get shortchanged, I promise.
There is a catch, of course. You'll have to activate the main console by sending override commands from the remote terminals.
Grathan protects his computers with lethal security forces--war droids, cyborgs, even genetically engineered weapons. Expect heavy resistance.
I will destroy anything that crosses my path.
Nothing will stop me.
I have no doubt of that.
Your concerns are ill-placed. The dark side protects me.
Don't worry about me.
Of course--but a little early warning never hurts.
I'm always ready for anything.
I came prepared for it.
That's good, because you might encounter just about anything.
I live for that kind of trouble.
Not gonna be a problem.
Must be exhilarating. As long as trouble doesn't kill you.
Good advice.
It's the least I can do.
Spare me the warning.
Your fearlessness is inspiring. I just don't want anything interfering with our goal.
Take this data spike. Insert it into the main console at Grathan's central lab. The spike will download all the data we need.
When you're done, bring me the spike. I'll arrange its sale and transfer credits to your account. Go now--be swift!
No. [Refuse quest]
Not willing to even try, eh? Fine. If you change your mind, I'll be slaving away in here.
Destroy this place to your heart's content. I won't stand in your way.
